page.title: 08CLAUGHTON HALL:History
page.content: Dating from Elizabethan Times Claughton Hall originally adjoined Claughton Hall Farm.By the 1920Â£s it was derelict and used as a farm store.Edmund Morse,Man- aging Director of WilliamsonÂ£s Lino bought it and had it moved 1931-35,away from the noisy A683 and railway,to itÂ£s present site.The move cost 26000 pou- nds,a million pounds today.The oriel window in the Great Hall came from the farm house and 14th century linen fold panelling came from a Hertfordshire tithe barn.There are forty rooms,mainly small,including 11 bedrooms and 8 bath- rooms.Problems of living there are heating and maintenance costs,and the steep access road which can be difficult in winter.
